_header: Of all the witty men and wise I warn all I thee watch
Subjects: satires; abuses of the age; Church, criticism/satire of
_description: The Papelard Priest — nine 10-line alliterative stanzas with ‘O and I’ refrain

BLAdd45896.First Lines:
Of Alle ȝe witti men and wise I warne Alle in ȝe
                    wacheȝat in worchipe wol wone in wele oȝer in
                    wynne…
BLAdd45896.Last Lines:
…Wyt an on and an I witouten eny wyrI may noust wyue and
                    ȝriue al in a ȝereExplicit ȝeddyngus de prust
                    papelard
BLAdd45896.Note:
Transcription derives from Revard (2001)
XRevard,  Carter. 
             “The Papelard Priest and the Black Prince’s Men: Audiences
                of an Alliterative Poem c.a. 1350-1370.” 
             Studies in the Age of Chaucer
         (2001): 359-406.
